intro: Oxystophyllum ambotiense, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
